meanings.definition: A traditional Okinawan weapon consisting of two sticks connected by a chain or rope.
meanings.sent1: He practiced using the nunchuks to improve his martial arts skills.
meanings.sent2: The ninja expertly wielded the nunchuks in the demonstration.
meanings.sent3: During the training, he accidentally hit himself with the nunchuks.
meanings.sent4: Her swift movements with the nunchuks were like a dance of danger.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the nunchuks striking echoed in the dojo.

meanings.definition: A pair of wooden or metal sticks used as a weapon in martial arts.
meanings.sent1: The sensei taught the students how to handle the nunchuks safely.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the nunchuks on display.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy thief tried to steal the nunchuks but dropped them noisily.
meanings.sent4: His determination to master the nunchuks was as strong as steel.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the nunchuks caught the sunlight, mesmerizing the audience.
